de.polygonal.gl.color.ARGB

type
class
Static fields/methods:
A helper class for working with 32-bit color values expressed as a single unsigned value. The additional eight bits are used to store the alpha channel.
Non-static fields/methods:
Defines a 32-bit color value expressed as a RGB triplet (r,g,b) using three doubles in the range 0 to 1 (255) to store the red, green, and blue intensity and a fourth double to store the alpha channel.

Static Variables

BLACK(inline,null) : Int

0xff000000

BLUE(inline,null) : Int

0xff0000ff

CYAN(inline,null) : Int

0xff00ffff

GREEN(inline,null) : Int

0xff00ff00

MAGENTA(inline,null) : Int

0xffff00ff

RED(inline,null) : Int

0xffff0000

WHITE(inline,null) : Int

0xffffffff

YELLOW(inline,null) : Int

0xffffff00

getA(inline,null) : x : Int -> Int

Gets the alpha component as an 8-bit value in the range 0 to 255.

getAf(inline,null) : x : Int -> Float

Gets the alpha component as a floating point value between 0 and 1 (255).

getB(inline,null) : x : Int -> Int

Gets the blue color component as an 8-bit value in the range 0 to 255.

getBf(inline,null) : x : Int -> Float

Gets the blue color component as a floating point value between 0 and 1 (255).

getG(inline,null) : x : Int -> Int

Gets the green color component as an 8-bit value in the range 0 to 255.

getGf(inline,null) : x : Int -> Float

Gets the green color component as a floating point value between 0 and 1 (255).

getR(inline,null) : x : Int -> Int

Gets the red color component as an 8-bit value in the range 0 to 255.

getRGB(inline,null) : x : Int -> Int

Returns the RGB portion.

getRf(inline,null) : x : Int -> Float

Gets the red color component as a floating point value between 0 and 1 (255).

setA(inline,null) : x : Int -> a : Int -> Int

Sets the alpha component of x to the 8-bit value of a.

setARGBf(inline,null) : a : Float -> r : Float -> g : Float -> b : Float -> Int

Creates an 32-bit ARGB color value using four double values a,r,g,b in the range [0,1] for the alpha, red, green and blue components, respectively.

setARGBi(inline,null) : a : Int -> r : Int -> g : Int -> b : Int -> Int

Creates an 32-bit ARGB color value using four 8-bit values a,r,g,b for the alpha, red, green and blue components, respectively.

setAf(inline,null) : x : Int -> a : Float -> Int

Sets the alpha component of x to the floating point value of a in the range [0,1].

setB(inline,null) : x : Int -> b : Int -> Int

Sets the blue color component of x to the 8-bit value of b.

setBf(inline,null) : x : Int -> b : Float -> Int

Sets the blue color component of x to the floating point value of b in the range [0,1].

setG(inline,null) : x : Int -> g : Int -> Int

Sets the green color component of x to the 8-bit value of g.

setGf(inline,null) : x : Int -> g : Float -> Int

Sets the green color component of x to the floating point value of g in the range [0,1].

setR(inline,null) : x : Int -> r : Int -> Int

Sets the red color component of x to the 8-bit value of r.

setRGB(inline,null) : x : Int -> r : Int -> g : Int -> b : Int -> Int

Sets the RGB portion using r,g,b for the red, green and blue component, respectively.

setRf(inline,null) : x : Int -> r : Float -> Int

Sets the red color component of x to the floating point value of r in the range [0,1].

toARGB(inline,null) : x : Int -> ARGB

Constructor

new()
Creates a new 32-bit ARGB color object using a for alpha, r for red, g for green and b for blue.

Instance Variables

a : Float

The value of the alpha component in the range [0,1].

b : Float

The value of the blue color component in the range [0,1].

copy(inline,null) : target : ARGB -> ARGB

Copies the values of the ARGB object into target and returns target.

g : Float

The value of the green color component in the range [0,1].

get24(inline,null) : Void -> Int

Converts the ARGB color object to an 24-bit unsigned integer.

get32(inline,null) : Void -> Int

Converts the ARGB color object to an 32-bit unsigned integer.

getA8(inline,null) : Void -> Int

Converts the alpha channel to an 8-bit unsigned integer.

getB8(inline,null) : Void -> Int

Converts the blue color channel to an 8-bit unsigned integer.

getG8(inline,null) : Void -> Int

Converts the green color channel to an 8-bit unsigned integer.

getR8(inline,null) : Void -> Int

Converts the red color channel to an 8-bit unsigned integer.

lerp(inline,null) : input : ARGB -> t : Float -> output : ARGB -> Void

Linearly interpolates between this and input: this = this + (input-this) * t.

r : Float

The value of the red color component in the range [0,1].

set(inline,null) : a : Float -> r : Float -> g : Float -> b : Float -> Void

Assigns values for the alpha a, red (r), green (g) and blue (b) component.

set24(inline,null) : r : Int -> g : Int -> b : Int -> Void

Assigns a red (r), green (g) and blue (b) value using three 8-bit unsigned integers.

set32(inline,null) : a : Int -> r : Int -> g : Int -> b : Int -> Void

Assigns an alpha (a), red (r), green (g) and blue (b) value using three 8-bit unsigned integers.

toString(default,method) : Void -> String

Returns a string representing the current object.
